alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 1:07PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Graham and northwestern Cochise Counties through 145 PM MST... At 107 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles northwest of Willcox, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Grant and Bonita. This includes Route 266 between mile markers 121 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford
